com.esri.mo2.src.sys
Interface ContentVisitor

public interface ContentVisitor

You can traverse a Folder tree by providing an implementation of LayerVisitor and calling ContentUtility's traverse method. ContentUtility will traverse the tree and callback the ContentVisitor's visiting() method with each Content found in the tree. The visiting() method can choose to throw any RuntimeException to indicate traversal should complete immediately. ContentUtility.traverse will not catch the exception, so calling code must catch it if thrown.

See Also:
Folder, ContentUtility.traverse(com.esri.mo2.src.sys.Folder, com.esri.mo2.src.sys.ContentVisitor)

Method Summary
 boolean visiting(Content content)
          ContentUtility.traverse will call this method for each Content visited in a Folder tree.
 

Method Detail

visiting

public boolean visiting(Content content)
ContentUtility.traverse will call this method for each Content visited in a Folder tree. You can control the traversal either by returning a true/false return value, to indicate that (if the current content is itself a Folder) traversal "into" the current Content is allowed or not, or, by throwing a RuntimeException to immediately stop the the traversal.

Parameters:
content - the Content currently being "visited"
Returns:
true == continue traversal "into" the current Content if it is itself a Folder, false == otherwise
Throws:
RuntimeException - to terminate traversal immediately
See Also:
ContentUtility.traverse(com.esri.mo2.src.sys.Folder, com.esri.mo2.src.sys.ContentVisitor)
